item.title: Assassin’s Creed Shadows Update Finally Lets You… Jump?
item.content:encoded:
Ubisoft isn’t finished with Assassin’s Creed Shadows, which dropped last year to a positive reception and a few controversies, particularly those concerning historical inaccuracies. It became a talking point within the Japanese government, amongst other things, which was pretty insane to see.

Tomorrow, February 17, Ubisoft will release title update 1.1.8 for Assassin’s Creed Shadows, kick-starting a special, limited-time parkour challenge, and adding a feature that many think should have been there the entire time.

Yes, that’s the ability to jump.

Manual Jump Coming to Assassin’s Creed Shadows

Forced automatic parkour will be a thing of the past in Assassin’s Creed Shadows with update 1.1.8. Ubisoft is encouraging those still playing the game to participate in a social-driven parkour challenge, creating an unedited shot that they can share to showcase their freerunning abilities in Feudal Japan.

There are prizes up for grabs, but only the cleanest routes will be in with a chance of winning.

To facilitate the challenge, Ubisoft has added manual jumping to Assassin’s Creed Shadows. That now means that, at the press of a button, you can jump. How’s about that for an update?

If you want to enable manual jumping, you’ll need to hop into Advanced Options in the gameplay settings menu and switch the feature on. Otherwise, you’ll still be locked in a creative box by automatic parkour.

Elsewhere, Ubisoft is adding a detailed statistics page and new ‘visual feedback’ for crit hits landed in combat.

Next month, Claws of Awaji, the game’s major expansion, will be released on Nintendo Switch 2. Then, on March 20, the game’s first anniversary rolls around, and Ubisoft has promised something of a small celebration.

Tomorrow’s update will drop at 14:00 UTC and will measure up to 15.77 GB for Xbox users, and as little as 1.7 GB for PS5 users.

Are you looking forward to making some sweet parkour content in Assassin’s Creed Shadows with manual jumping? Let us know on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Call of Duty Warzone is going offline

Written by

Senior Editor and Esports Lead

Grant's adoration for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC in 1996. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with a deep love for the industry, a passion for esports, and more…

More from Grant Taylor-Hill

item.title: WWE 2K26 MyGM Features Extended Season and New Match Types
item.content:encoded:
WWE 2K26 brings a new MyGM draft format, additional playable GMs, expanded match types, and more, as a deeper level of control takes center stage.

WWE 2K has released a new Ringside Report, giving players an in-depth look at the changes coming to the popular game mode. Major changes include more match types for players to select, a longer season mode than ever before, and new choices for the authority figure on your show.

Default Seasons Are Now 50 Weeks in WWE 2K26 MyGM

WWE 2K26 features 50-week seasons by default in MyGM. Also, starting budgets have increased and now range from $3 million to $7 million. Everyone’s budget is $5 million by default.

It is expected that higher budgets will increase the average roster size per brand by up to 35 Superstars. There’s also a new difficulty setting, Immortal, for experienced players looking for a new challenge.

Players Can Choose to Double-Book Stars

Another new feature is the ability to double-book wrestlers in both promos and matches on a single show. This means players will need to manage their roster members’ stamina more closely and pay closer attention to the show’s format, but it adds more realism.

Speaking of promos, invasion promises are new to WWE 2K26. Players can now send a star to attack the opposing brand when playing against friends. A good promo will earn you fans; a bad promo will make your brand look bad and could cost you fans.

As for match types, players can now book wrestlers for a variety of options, including the new 3 Stages of Hell. There’s also now support for 5-way, 6-way, and 8-way matches.

New Legendary GMs Are Added in This Year’s Game

This year, MyGM Mode added new playable general managers, including the legendary Bobby “The Brain” Heenan, Stacy Keibler, and the Anonymous General Manager from 2011. They join Eric Bischoff, Adam Pearce, Mick Foley, and Ava.

Are you excited to play through MyGM Mode in WWE 2K26? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: NYT Connections Hints Today (#982)—Answers for Tuesday, February 17
item.content:encoded:
How has your week started? Let’s hope you’re on a high note and the rest of the week is looking great. We’ve got another batch of NYT Connections hints and solutions for you to dig into below. If you want to finish today’s puzzle as quickly as possible, look no further than this guide.

Here are the NYT Connections answers for today’s puzzle – just scroll down!

How to Play NYT Connections

In June 2023, NYT Connections emerged as yet another game in the ever-growing lineup of the New York Times titles. This title soared immediately, and it’s easy to see why. As a free-to-play, accessible New York Times game, NYT Connections is available worldwide and can be played on desktop devices or in a mobile app.

But how do you play NYT Connections?

The NYT team will provide you with a grid of 16 words once a day. The only task left up to you is to sort those words into four groups of four by finding their commonalities. Every NYT Connections puzzle has just one solution, and some words can have double meanings, so it can sometimes be tricky to figure out the answers.

It’s also important to stress that the words are color-coded: yellow, blue, green, and purple. That’s in order of difficulty, from least to most.

What’s critical here is that you get four guesses every day, and if you use those, your NYT Connections answers for today will be out of reach, as it’ll be game over.

Today’s NYT Connections Hints (February 17)

Here are the words from today’s NYT Connections puzzle:

  • PLUM
  • LEAF
  • FLASH
  • BUSTLE
  • THUMB
  • OYSTER
  • FLOPPY
  • ZIP
  • SKIM
  • SOY
  • DART
  • BOMBAY
  • SPEED
  • FLIP
  • HOISIN
  • MISSUS

And here are the hints I can offer for today’s NYT Connections:

  • Yellow – Ways to describe moving quickly
  • Green – Words that you might associate with Chinese food
  • Blue – Words to describe flipping through a book
  • Purple – Look at the first half of the word for ways to fail

Here’s the final warning before we get to the NYT Connections answers for today, February 17:

Are you sure you want to scroll further?

Very well!

NYT Connections Answers Explained for Today, February 17 (#982)

If you want to jump straight to the answers for today’s NYT Connections puzzle, I’ve got you covered:

  • Yellow – DART, FLASH, SPEED, ZIP
  • Green – HOISIN, OYSTER, PLUM, SOY
  • Blue – FLIP, LEAF, SKIM, THUMB
  • Purple – BOMBAY, BUSTLE, FLOPPY, MISSUS

When Does NYT Connections Reset?

That’s today’s puzzle, but if you want the next one, the game resets daily at midnight local time (that’s your local time). You’ll have 24 hours to complete the puzzle when midnight ticks over in your timezone.

How did you do? Did you get a perfect run? Let me know what your streak looks like on the Insider Gaming Discord server

Written by

Senior Editor and Esports Lead

Grant's adoration for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC in 1996. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with a deep love for the industry, a passion for esports, and more…

More from Grant Taylor-Hill

item.title: Call of Duty: Warzone Mobile to Go Offline in Two Months
item.content:encoded:
Activision is sunsetting Call of Duty: Warzone Mobile.

Activision has announced that Call of Duty: Warzone Mobile’s servers will go offline on April 17, two months from now. The game was officially removed from stores in May 2025 following several service changes, including an end to delivering new seasonal content and gameplay updates.

The final step is underway, and the game will go offline on April 17. In a statement, Activision thanked players for their passion and feedback.

“We are deeply grateful to the community that supported Call of Duty: Warzone Mobile and to the developers who brought the experience to life. Player passion and feedback continue to shape the future of the Call of Duty® franchise, and we look forward to delivering meaningful seasonal content and updates to Call of Duty: Mobile,” they stated.

Call of Duty: Warzone Mobile Existed For 2 Years

Warzone Mobile went live on March 21, 2024. Players currently have Call of Duty: Mobile as their mobile experience.

Call of Duty: Mobile recently launched its first season, titled “Frozen Abyss.” The season, which launched on January 14, boasts new rewards earned across a variety of events, including a Street Fighter-themed event.

Call of Duty: Mobile also features a Battle Royale mode, giving Warzone Mobile players access to a beloved feature. There’s also Zombies, Multiplayer, and more.

Do you have any fond memories of Warzone Mobile? Do you currently play the standard version of Call of Duty: Mobile? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Who Bought Logan Paul’s Pokémon Card? World’s Most Expensive Pokémon Card Buyer, Explained
item.content:encoded:
The talk of the Pokémon world has been the elusive Pikachu Illustrator card in Logan Paul’s possession, or should that be rectified, formerly, in his possession. The world’s most expensive Pokémon card is now even more valuable, and the identity behind the buyer is fascinating.

Logan Paul once sported his outrageously expensive Pikachu Illustrator card around his neck as he walked down the ramp for Wrestlemania. Dubbed ‘The most coveted card in the world,” the PSA Grade 10 Pokémon Illustrator card is as rare as a Pokémon card gets, and it changed hands for an extraordinary sum in 2026.

Who Bought The Pokémon Pikachu Illustrator Card From Logan Paul?

AJ Scaramucci is now the owner of the world’s most expensive Pokémon card after buying the Pikachu Illustrator card from Logan Paul for $16.492 million in an auction.

Monday, February 16, 2026, will go down in history as one of the most extraordinary auctions ever.

  • More Insider Gaming: Pokopia Hands-On Preview: Pokémon Has Another Mega Hit On Its Hands

Goldin has recognized that Paul’s Pikachu Illustrator PSA 10 card (with gold chain and all!) was sold for exactly $16,492,000—including Buyer’s Premium.

AJ Scaramucci is the lucky bidder who has claimed this incredible collector’s item, and Guinness World Records has said it’s the most expensive trading card ever sold at any auction.

Who Is AJ Scaramucci?

AJ Scaramucci is a wealthy venture capitalist, and you might know the name as he is the son of former White House communications director Anthony Scaramucci.

After winning the card, Scaramucci told Paul he wanted to collect even more unique items:

“I’m on a quest to buy a T-Rex dinosaur fossil, I’m going to buy the Declaration of Independence, and I’m not stopping there. This was only the beginning.”

You can’t knock the man’s ambitions! It remains to be seen if Scaramucci manages to obtain any of his other targets. The guarantee is that he now owns the only PSA 10-graded Pikachu Illustrator card in the world—the only one of the 39 to 41 cards printed.

How Much Did Logan Paul Buy His Pokémon Card For?

It seems like peanuts now, but Logan Paul had originally set the record for the most expensive Pokémon card trading purchase when he bought the Pikachu Illustrator card for $5.275 million in 2021.

Not bad profit, all things considered. Paul has made about $10 million profit from selling the card, and the Guinness World Record you can see above now goes to AJ Scaramucci.

  • More Insider Gaming: Pokémon is Releasing The Closest Thing You Can Get to a Real Pikachu

If Scaramucci is true to his word about collecting, then this record is likely to be broken again, and no one else will ever get to own this particular Pikachu Illustrator. If you have other ideas, you’d better get saving.

Is any collector’s card worth this much money? Or has AJ Scaramucci got himself an item that anyone would do anything for? Please share your thoughts through the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

Check out Pokémon EUIC 2026 Twitch Drops for more content.

item.title: Mewgenics Overtakes Hades II As Most-Played Roguelike Ever
item.content:encoded:
Mewgenics continues to make history in its first few days on Steam.

Mewgenics’ peak player count surpassed 115,000 on February 15. Now, having peaked at 115,428, it has surpassed Hades II as the most-played roguelike game of all time. Hades II’s peak was 112,947 players in September 2025.

Mewgenics has had a strong start in its first week on the market, currently holding a Metacritic rating of 89 and an overall user score of 8.0. By comparison, Hades II has a 95 on Metacritic. Hades II’s user score is currently sitting at an 8.6

The Future of Mewgenics

Edmund McMillen previously noted that he was surprised by the game’s success. He also stated that while he doesn’t know when the game will be finished, it is in development across multiple platforms and is targeting console releases. Learn more about that at this link.

McMillen has also discussed some of the more controversial voice cast members. He also explains that he strongly believed in casting people with diverse opinions. Read his full comments at this link.

Have you played Mewgenics? Do you think it’s better than Hades I or Hades II? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter. 

For more on successful independent games in early 2026, learn more about YAPYAP’s early success on Steam. With over 500,000 copies sold, the game’s development team has future plans, but is currently focused on smoothing out some of the game’s rougher edges.

item.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 Teased For Xbox Game Pass
item.content:encoded:
One of the most well-received games of 2025 could be heading to Xbox Game Pass. A post on social media on Monday talked about the future of additions to Xbox Game Pass this year, with a not-so-subtle tease of Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2.

“We’ve got quite the release slate lined up for Xbox Game Pass so far, this is going to be a huge year,” the “email” reads. “Oh, and speaking of upcoming releases… well, I shouldn’t say too much, but if you’re getting quite hungry for a fun adventure, all I can say is that something big is about to be deliverance’d to Xbox Game Pass…”

While not specifically naming the game, using the term “deliverance’d” is a dead giveaway for what’s to come. Xbox is getting ready to announce the next wave of games for the service, which could see it come sooner rather than later.

The original Kingdom Come: Deliverance is already available on the subscription service for those with an Ultimate, PC, or Premium membership.

Are you excited about the idea of Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 coming to game pass? Leave your thoughts down in the comments and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the six games canceled at Ubisoft when it announced its recent restructure. And for even more Insider Gaming delivered directly to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Mike has been covering the gaming industry since 2012, and has reported on some of the largest events in the industry while also working as an investigative reporter. Outside of…

More from Mike Straw
